alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, Decatur, southwestern Grady and southeastern Seminole Counties through 330 PM EDT/230 PM CDT/... At 259 PM EDT/159 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Chattahoochee, or 13 miles northwest of Quincy, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bainbridge, Quincy, Greensboro, West Bainbridge, Chattahoochee, Gretna, Attapulgus, Climax, Juniper, Douglas City, Rosedale, Recovery, Laingkat, Jinks, Amsterdam, Branchville, Nickleville, Dogtown, Mount Pleasant and Hardin Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
